comments:
This error situation occurs sporadically; when attempting to run a JUnit test, 
an errormessage telling that the test does not exist appears. Workaround is to 
exit Eclipse workbench and restart it.

Configuration:
Eclipse 2.1 RC3
Sun Java VM 1.4.1_01


This is output to the logfile:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 120 mar 27, 2003 15:46:58.693
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug UI: 
!STACK 1

	at

(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:141)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.findSingleT
est(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:126)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.getTestType
s(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:101)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.launch
(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:55)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:152)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:672)

(DebugUITools.java:537)

Launching tests has been rewritten for 3.2 and error reporting improved. Please reopen the bug if you can still see this problem.
